intro: Lampranthus glomeratus, commonly known as the clustered ice plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, clustered flowers. The plant produces bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Lampranthus glomeratus is often used in rock gardens and as a decorative plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
